name: Professor C. Lee Giles
description: Lee Giles cocreated CiteSeer in 1997 with Steve Lawrence and Kurt Bollacker while they were at the NEC Research Institute (now NEC Labs) in Princeton, New Jersey, USA. Now at the Pennsylvania State University, Dr. Giles continues the tradition of the CiteSeer project.

name: Dr. Jian Wu
description: Jian Wu is improving the CiteSeerx crawler and investigating our crawling policies and also maintains the CiteSeerx database, index and repository.

name: Dr. Cornelia Caragea
role: Assistant Professor at University of North Texas
description: Dr. Caragea contributed on data cleaning and integrity. She also extracted keyphrases from scientific documents.

name: Kunho Kim
description: Kunho Kim is responsible for the author disambiguation tasks and maintains the author search index.

name: Po-Yu Chuang
description: Po-Yu Chuang manages the CiteSeerx index data over Apache Solr.

name: Athar Sefid
description: Athar Sefid works with with Kunho Kim to maintain author disambiguation of CiteSeerX database.

name: Rabah Al-Zaidy
description: Rabah Al-Zaidy extracts trends and semantics from barcharts appearing in scientific documents.

name: Professor Prasenjit Mitra
description: Prasenjit Mitra guided the team which developed the table search feature for CiteSeerx and is a collaborator in the CiteSeerx project.

name: Dr. Madian Khabsa
description: Madian contributes to the CiteSeerx architecture and indexing.

name: Dr. Pradeep B. Teregowda
description: Pradeep guided many of the technical aspects of the CiteSeerx development process.

name: Dr. Kyle Williams
description: Kyle Williams was involved in the maintenance and development of CiteSeerx and manages the code repositories.

name: Eric Treece
description: Eric used to be the primary systems administrator for CiteSeerx's underlying hardware, network and operating system layers. He managed and maintain the CiteSeerx cloud infrastructure.

name: Douglas Jordan
description: Douglas Jordan used to be in charge of transferring CiteSeerx data.

name: Huaiyu (David) Yang
description: David worked with Jason Killian and co-developed the parallel extraction system for CiteSeerX.

name: Professor Jim Jansen
description: Jim investigates CiteSeerx useage.

name: Dr. Susan Gauch
description: Dr. Susan Gauch is noted for her contribution on clustering CiteSeerx data.

name: Jason Killian
description: Jason Killian developed the parallel extraction framework for CiteSeerX.

name: Dr. Puck Treeratpituk
description: Puck led the author disambiguation project.

name: Juan Pablo Fernández Ramírez
description: Juan was responsible for the collections feature of MyCiteSeer and general CiteSeerx bug squashing. He participated in developing document conversion routines and contributed in part to the navigation menu design and page layout for CiteSeerx and MyCiteSeerx. He was responsible for OAI metadata interface, external links and legacy corrections.

name: Dr. Shuyi Zheng
description: Shuyi scoured the web for millions of new document files and is largely responsible for bringing the CiteSeerx collection up to date with the latest literature on the net. He has also lead efforts, for integrating table search with CiteSeerx.

name: Dr. Isaac G. Councill
role: Consultant, Former Technical Director, Software/Deployment Architect, Principle Engineer
description: Isaac led all technical aspects of the CiteSeerx development process, designed the system framework, and wrote most of the code. Isaac maintained the legacy CiteSeer system since it moved to Penn State in 2003 and incorporated many hard-won lessons from that endeavor into the new codebase.

name: Dr. Ying Liu
description: Ying Liu researched and developed the table search system that underlies the table search features of CiteSeerx.

name: Professor Min-Yen Kan
description: Min-Yen Kan contributed the excellent conditional random field model that underlies the CiteSeerx citation parser, ParsCit, and collaborated with Isaac Councill to build the ParsCit application.

name: "Bernie" Nan Zang
description: Bernie was responsible for creating some of the interfaces you see in CiteSeerx, including the current UI.

name: Stephen Carman
description: Stephen facilitated CiteSeerx data transfer and code improvement.

name: Dr. Yang Song
description: Yang Song designed the prototype of MyCiteSeer.

name: Dr. Steve Lawrence
description: Steve was the creator of the original CiteSeer architecture and system.

name: Dr. Kurt Bollacker
description: Kurt was responsible for many innovative features in CiteSeer.
